title: Calculate AKI stage — calc_aki_stage
text: Calculate AKI class based serum creatinine values time, using various methods children (pRIFLE) adults (RIFLE, kDIGO)

title: Calculate AKI stage — calc_aki_stage
code: calc_aki_stage(   scr = NULL,   times = NULL,   method = "kdigo",   baseline_scr = "median",   baseline_egfr = NULL,   first_dose_time = NULL,   age = NULL,   egfr = NULL,   egfr_method = NULL,   force_numeric = FALSE,   override_prifle_baseline = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   return_object = TRUE,   ... )

title: Calculate AKI stage — calc_aki_stage
text: scr serum creatinine mg/dL. Use `convert_creat()` convert mmol/L. Values detection limit ("<0.2") converted numeric (0.2) times creatinine sample times hours method classification method, one `KDIGO`, `RIFLE`, `pRIFLE` (case insensitive) baseline_scr baseline serum creatinine, required `RIFLE` classifation. use value numeric. `character`, can either `median`, `median_before_treatment`, `lowest`, `first`. baseline_egfr baseline eGFR, required `RIFLE` classifations. take median `egfr` values `NULL`. first_dose_time time hours first dose relative sCr value, used calculate baseline serum creatinine `median_before_treatment` approach. age age years, needed eGFR used classification method egfr eGFR ml/min/1.73m^2. Optional, can also calcualted `age`, `weight`, `height`, `sex`, `egfr_method` specified arguments. egfr_method eGFR calculation method, used `calc_egfr()`. NULL, pick default based classification system (`cockroft_gault` RIFLE / kDIGO, `revised_schwartz` pRIFLE). force_numeric keep stage numeric (1, 2, 3), instead e.g. "R", "", "F" RIFLE. Default `FALSE`. override_prifle_baseline default, `pRIFLE` compares eGFR 120 ml/min. Override setting TRUE. verbose verbose (`TRUE` `FALSE`) return_object return object detailed data (default `TRUE`). `FALSE`, just return maximum stage. ... arguments passed `calc_egfr()`

title: Calculate AKI stage — calc_aki_stage
text: pRIFLE: Ackan-Arikan et al. "Modified RIFLE criteria critically ill children acute kidney injury." Kidney Int. (2007) RIFLE: Bellomo et al. "Acute renal failure - definition, outcome measures, animal models, fluid therapy information technology needs: Second International Consensus Conference Acute Dialysis Quality Initiative (ADQI) Group." Critical Care. (2004) KDIGO: Khwaja. "KDIGO clinical practice guidelines acute kidney injury." Nephron Clinical Practice. (2012) pRIFLE baseline eGFR: Soler et al. "pRIFLE (Pediatric Risk, Injury, Failure, Loss, End Stage Renal Disease) score identifies Acute Kidney Injury predicts mortality critically ill children : prospective study." Pediatric Critical Care Medicine. (2014)

title: Calculate AKI stage — calc_aki_stage
code: calc_aki_stage(   scr = c(0.7, 0.9, 1.8, 1.5),   t = c(0, 40, 100, 130),   age = 50, weight = 60,   height = 170, sex = "female") #> No baseline SCr value specified, using *median* of supplied values. #> Creatinine unit not specified, assuming mg/dL. #> Warning: No baseline eGFR value specified, using median of supplied values. #> Please note: Urinary output is not taken into account in staging. #> $stage #> [1] "stage 1" #>  #> $time_max_stage #> [1] 100 #>  #> $data #>   scr   t deltat baseline_scr baseline_scr_diff baseline_scr_reldiff stage #> 1 0.7   0      0          1.2              -0.5           -0.4166667    NA #> 2 0.9  40     40          1.2              -0.3           -0.2500000    NA #> 3 1.8 100     60          1.2               0.6            0.5000000     1 #> 4 1.5 130     30          1.2               0.3            0.2500000    NA #>       egfr baseline_egfr_diff baseline_egfr_reldiff #> 1 92.95488           35.11629             0.6071429 #> 2 72.29824           14.45965             0.2500000 #> 3 36.14912          -21.68947            -0.3750000 #> 4 43.37894          -14.45965            -0.2500000 #>  #> $method #> [1] "kdigo" #>

title: Calculate eGFR — calc_egfr
text: Calculate estimated glomerular filtration rate (indicator renal  function) based measured serum creatinine using one following  approaches: Cockcroft-Gault (using weight, ideal body weight, adjusted body weight) C-G spinal cord injury (using correction factor 0.7, representing      median correction point reported original publication (parapalegic     patients: 0.8; tetrapalegic patients: 0.6)) Revised Lund-Malmo Modification Diet Renal Disease study (MDRD;      without consideration race, using either original equation      (published 2001) equation updated reflect serum creatinine      assay standardization (2006)) CKD-EPI (without consideration race, 2021 re-fit without race) Schwartz Schwartz revised / bedside Jelliffe Jelliffe unstable renal function. Note 15     P_adj recommended hemodialysis patients included      implementation. Wright equation eGFR cancer patients, creatinine measured     using Jaffe assay. Equations estimation eGFR Cystatin C concentrations available `calc_egfr_cystatin()` function.

title: Calculate eGFR — calc_egfr
code: calc_egfr(   method = "cockcroft_gault",   sex = NULL,   age = NULL,   scr = NULL,   scr_unit = NULL,   race = "other",   weight = NULL,   height = NULL,   bsa = NULL,   preterm = FALSE,   ckd = FALSE,   times = NULL,   bsa_method = "dubois",   relative = NULL,   unit_out = "mL/min",   verbose = TRUE,   min_value = NULL,   max_value = NULL,   fail = TRUE,   ... )

title: Calculate eGFR — calc_egfr

See Note section important considerations using race predictive factor eGFR. weight weight, `kg` height height, `cm`, used converting /BSA-normalized units. bsa body surface area preterm patient preterm? Used Schwartz method. ckd chronic kidney disease? Used Schwartz method. times vector sampling times (days!) creatinine (used Jelliffe equation unstable patients) bsa_method BSA estimation method, see `calc_bsa()` details relative `TRUE`/`FALSE`. Report eGFR per 1.73 m2? Requires BSA re-calculation required. `NULL` (=default), choose value typical `method`. unit_out `ml/min` (default), `L/hr`, `mL/hr` verbose verbosity, show guidance warnings. `TRUE` default min_value minimum value (`NULL` default). cap applied unit `unit_out`. max_value maximum value (`NULL` default). cap applied unit `unit_out`. fail invoke `stop()` covariates available? ... arguments passed `calc_abw` `calc_dosing_weight`

title: Calculate eGFR — calc_egfr
text: MDRD CKD-EPI equations use race factor estimation GFR. Racism   historically continues problem medicine, racialized patients   experiencing poorer outcomes. Given context, use race clinical algorithms   considered carefully (Vyas et al., NEJM (2020)).   Provided versions CKD-EPI MDRD equations consider race   patient. Removing race GFR estimation may lead worse outcomes Black patients    contexts (Casal et al., Lancet (2021)).    hand, including race GFR estimation may also prevent Black patients    obtaining procedures like kidney transplants   (Zelnick, et al. JAMA Netw Open. (2021)).   2021, NKF/ASN Task Force Reassessing Inclusion Race Diagnosing Kidney Diseases   published revised versions CKD-EPI equations refit original data race excluded,    may produce less biased estimates    (Inker, et al., NEJM (2021)).

title: Calculate eGFR — calc_egfr
text: Cockcroft-Gault: Cockcroft & Gault, Nephron (1976) Cockcroft-Gault spinal cord injury: Mirahmadi et al., Paraplegia (1983) Revised Lund-Malmo: Nyman et al., Clinical Chemistry Laboratory Medicine (2014) MDRD: Manjunath et al., Curr. Opin. Nephrol. Hypertens. (2001)      Levey et al., Clinical Chemistry (2007). (See Note.) CKD-EPI: Levey et al., Annals Internal Medicine (2009). (See Note.) CKD-EPI (2021): Inker, et al., NEJM (2021). Schwartz: Schwartz et al., Pediatrics (1976) Schwartz revised / bedside: Schwartz et al., Journal American Society Nephrology (2009) Jelliffe: Jelliffe, Annals Internal Medicine (1973) Jelliffe unstable renal function: Jelliffe, American Journal Nephrology (2002) Wright: Wright et al., British Journal Cancer (2001)

text: weight weight kg height height cm age age years sex sex method_children method use children >1 <18 years. Currently `"standard"` method supported. method_adults method use >=18 years. Currently `"devine"` method supported (Devine BJ. Drug Intell Clin Pharm. 1974;8:650-655).

title: Calculate ideal body weight in kg for children and adults — calc_ibw
text: Equations: <1yo Use actual body weight 1-17 years old ('standard'):   height < 5ft:     IBW= (height cm2 x 1.65)/1000   height > 5ft:     IBW (male) = 39 + (2.27 x height inches 5 feet)     IBW (female) = 42.2 + (2.27 x height inches 5 feet) Methods implemented yet:   McLaren: IBW =     - step1:   x = 50th percentile height given age     - step2: IBW = 50th percentile weight x weight--height scale   Moore: IBW = weight percentile x given age, x percentile height given age   BMI: IBW = 50th percentile BMI given age x (height m)^2   ADA: IBW = 50th percentile WT given age >= 18 years old (Devine equation)   IBW (male) = 50 + (2.3 x height inches 5 feet)   IBW (female) = 45.5 + (2.3 x height inches 5 feet)

title: Calculate ideal body weight in kg for children and adults — calc_ibw

Calculate kinetic GFR — calc_kgfr
text: Calculate kinetic GFR based patients first two serum creatinine measurements. Kinetic GFR may predictive future AKI patients whose serum creatinine changing quickly. Briefly, increase SCr course day indicates effective GFR lower recent SCr measurement may indicate steadystate assumed, decrease SCr short time indicates higher effective GFR recent SCr indicate. several ways approximating maximum theoretical creatinine accumulation rate; method used Pianta et al., (PLoS ONE, 2015) implemented.

code: nca(   data = NULL,   dose = 100,   tau = 24,   method = c("log_linear", "log_log", "linear"),   scale = list(auc = 1, conc = 1),   dv_min = 0.001,   t_inf = NULL,   fit_samples = NULL,   weights = NULL,   extend = TRUE,   has_baseline = TRUE,   route = c("iv", "oral", "im", "sc") )

title: Perform an NCA based on a NONMEM-style dataset — nca
text: data data.frame time dv columns dose dose amount tau dosing frequency, default 24. method `linear`, `log_linear` (default), `log_log` scale list scaling auc concentration (`conc`) dv_min minimum concentrations, lower observations set value t_inf infusion time, defaults 0 fit_samples vector sample indexes used fit calculate elimination rate, e.g. `c(3,4,5)`. specified (default), evaluate last n samples shows largest adjusted R^2 log-transformed data fitted using linear regression, use samples estimation elimination rate. weights vector weights used linear regression (size specified concentration data), function concentration argument. extend perform 'extended' NCA, .e. calculation AUCs, back-extend expected true Cmax also include area. has_baseline included data include baseline? `FALSE`, baseline set zero. route administration route, `iv` (intravenous, default), `oral`, `sc` (sub-cutaneous), `im` (intra-muscular).

title: Perform an NCA based on a NONMEM-style dataset — nca
text: Returns list three lists:  pk Lists pk parameters. kel: elimination constant t_12: half-life v: distribution volume cl: clearance  descriptive Lists exposure parameters. cav_t: average concentration first observation last observation without extrapolating tau cav_tau: average concentration 0 tau cmin: extrapolated concentration time = tau c_max_true: available extend = TRUE, extrapolated peak concentration c_max: available extend = FALSE, observed maximum concentration auc_inf: extrapolated AUC time goes infinity auc_24: extrapolated AUC 24 hours, provided doses administered auc_tau: extrapolated AUC end dosing interval auc_t: AUC time last observation  settings Lists dosing information. dose: dose quantity tau: dosing interval
